title: Diploma in Body Language for Professional Success
headline: In this free online course, learn about the components and theories involved in Body Language for Professional Success.
description: In this free online course, learn about the components and theories involved in Body Language for Professional Success. Learn the definition of nonverbal communication and the components of body language. Paralanguage, which refers to what is left and perceived after deducting the verbal contents of a speech, will be discussed. Boost your Body Language for Professional Success knowledge and skills by studying this comprehensive course.

courseDescription:
In this free online course, you are introduced to the world of Body Language for Professional Success. You will explore the four Standard Interaction Distances, as well as the process of classifying Micro Expressions and the Evolution of Digital Body Language. Demonstrations, problems, examples and assessment questions in this instructor-led video-based course, are designed to provide you with a comprehensive foundation, which will enable you to take serious steps into this career.

The course begins by introducing you to the definition of Body Language and Nonverbal Communication. Then, the concept of Proxemics in Body Language will be discussed, which describes how we treat our space and other people's space in terms of proximity. You will explore the concept of Kinesics, a systematic study of how human beings communicate through body movements and gestures.

Next, you will learn about Proxemics Behavioral Connotations and Oculesics. You will gain insight into the Role of Eye Contact in the communication process, and you will discover the importance of understanding Body Movements. Finally, you will study Paralanguage, Chronemics, and Digital Body Language. This course will be of interest to Social Science students, or those professionals in Management, Communication or Human Resource fields. Why wait? Start this course today.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Body Language and Proxemics, you will learn about the four basic zones of Proxemics and the Connotations of Proxemics. You will also learn about Oculesics which refers to the use of the eyes in the communication process.
topics: Body Language and Proxemics - Learning Outcomes
Body Language and Proxemics - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Haptics and Facial Expressions, you will learn about the Role of Haptics, particularly in handshakes. You will also learn about the benefits of understanding Macro and Micro Facial Expressions.
topics: Haptics and Facial Expressions - Learning Outcomes
Haptics and Facial Expressions - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Understanding Body Movements, you will learn the Significance of Smiles and the meaning of different mouth gestures. You will also learn about the Cultural Differences in Smiles and Head Nods.

modules.description: In this module, Components of Body Language, you will learn about the connotations of Paralanguage in the context of non-verbal communication. You will also learn about the Constraints and Boundaries of Body Language.

  • Lesson Summary

  • In this module you learned:
    • The study of Body Language is important because it alerts us to inconsistencies between what one says and what one conveys.
    • Proxemics refers to the analysis of the communicator’s sense of physical distance with the recipient in terms of signals and codes.
    • Nonverbal communication involves those nonverbal stimuli in a communication setting that are generated by both the source and his or her use of the environment and that have potential message value for the source or receiver.
    • The Knowledge of Body Language averts misinterpretations, conflicts, and antagonism that often occurs amongst people.
    • Proxemics in Body Language describes how we treat our space and other people in terms of proximity.
    • Edward Hall defines Proxemics as the study of “ways in which man gains knowledge of the content of other men’s minds through judgments of behavior patterns associated with varying degree of proximity.”
    • Proxemics identifies the culturally dependent ways in which people use interpersonal distance to comprehend and mediate their interactions.

  • Lesson Summary

  • In this module you learned:
    • The study of Body Language is important because it alerts us to inconsistencies between what one says and what one conveys.
    • Proxemics refers to the analysis of the communicator’s sense of physical distance with the recipient in terms of signals and codes.
    • Nonverbal communication involves those nonverbal stimuli in a communication setting that are generated by both the source and his or her use of the environment and that have potential message value for the source or receiver.
    • The Knowledge of Body Language averts misinterpretations, conflicts, and antagonism that often occurs amongst people.
    • Proxemics in Body Language describes how we treat our space and other people in terms of proximity.
    • Edward Hall defines Proxemics as the study of “ways in which man gains knowledge of the content of other men’s minds through judgments of behavior patterns associated with varying degree of proximity.”
    • Proxemics identifies the culturally dependent ways in which people use interpersonal distance to comprehend and mediate their interactions.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • On successful completion of this module you will be able to:
    • Discuss the different 'Types of Handshakes'
    • Explain the Role of Haptics particularly in the workplace
    • Describe the Types of Kinesics and their Importance
    • Discuss the Facial Expression Motion Cues
    • Differentiate between Macro and Micro Expressions

  • Lesson Summary

  • In this module you learned:
    • The Three Sub-divisions of Haptics are:
    1. Human Haptics
    2. Machine Haptics
    3. Computer Haptics
    • Haptics is the study of communication involving touch, whereas body language is an all-inclusive term referring to non-verbal communications involving the body.
    • Socially sanctioned polite touching behaviours help initiate interactions and show that others are included and respected.
    • Kinesics is defined as the systematic study of how human beings communicate through body movements and gestures.
    • Affective Displays are movements of the body that informs us about the emotional state a person is experiencing or faking.

  • Lesson Summary

  • In this module you learned:
    • The Three Sub-divisions of Haptics are:
    1. Human Haptics
    2. Machine Haptics
    3. Computer Haptics
    • Haptics is the study of communication involving touch, whereas body language is an all-inclusive term referring to non-verbal communications involving the body.
    • Socially sanctioned polite touching behaviours help initiate interactions and show that others are included and respected.
    • Kinesics is defined as the systematic study of how human beings communicate through body movements and gestures.
    • Affective Displays are movements of the body that informs us about the emotional state a person is experiencing or faking.
